Uses of Class
htds.User

    • Uses of User in htds

      Fields in htds declared as User 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private User DBConnector.g_user 
      Methods in htds that return User 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      User DBConnector.login(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      This function controls the login activity of a User to the HTDS system by comparing a pair of username of password to the user information stored in the database Reference: [Design Document v6.0]: 5.1 Sequence Diagram 1: Login
      Methods in htds with parameters of type User 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean DBConnector.addUser(User user)
      5.6 Sequence Diagram 6: Add User
      Alert[] DBConnector.getAlerts(User user)
      This method queries the database for all Alerts generated by a given user
      Data[] DBConnector.getData(User user)
      Sequence Diagram 11: View Data
      Retrieves all the data that has been generated by the user from the database
      boolean DBConnector.removeUser(User user)
      To remove a user from the database
      boolean DBConnector.updateUserPassword(User user, java.lang.String password)
      Sequence Diagram 8: Update User
      Changes the password of the given user.
      Only the administrator has the power to change the passwords of the users
      the users do not have the power to change their own passwords.
      Constructors in htds with parameters of type User 
      Constructor and Description
      AlertLog(int id, User user, DataLog dataLog, java.sql.Date date, AlertProfile alertProfile)
      Constructor 4 This constructor is similar to the basic constructor except that an object of type AlertProfile is passed instead of an integer referring to the AlertProfile id
      AlertProfileLog(int alertProfileLogID, User user, java.lang.String alertDescription, java.sql.Date date)
      Constructor 3
      DataLog(int logID, User user, java.lang.String fileName, java.sql.Date date)
      This constructor is similar to the basic constructor, except that an object of type User is passed instead of the userID
      User(User user)
      This constructor creates an object of type User with same properties as the passed User object
